name: FROST AT MIDNIGHT
description:
"The Frost performs its secret ministry ..." This painting was inspired by Coleridge's 1798 poem of the same name. The picture was Editor's Choice in The Leisure Painter Magazine in December 2011.  A beautiful piece, darkest bluey purple sky with thickly painted moon abstracted.  Greens and whites convey a frosty mood.

From a limited edition run of only 95
printed on Hahnemuhle acid-free 300 gsm etching paper
image size 30 x 30cms, paper size 35 x 35 cms
signed, titled and numbered by the artist
postage and packaging inclusive

name: WINTER HILLS
description:
a lovely winter scene from an original painting inspired by Loch Lomond in Scotland.  Cold, snowy scene with sweeping brush marks visible in this print. 

From a limited edition run of only 95

printed on Hahnemuhle acid-free 300 gsm etching paper

image size 30 x 30cms

paper size 35 x 35 cms

signed, titled and numbered by the artist

FREE postage and packaging

name: LIGHT OF THE WORLD
description:
Spiritual blues and turquoise greens express sea, horizon and ethereal light from the sun - from an original oil painting by Lesley Birch.  An excellent print with the immediecy of the palette knife marks clearly visible. View What Customers Say link.   

From a limited edition run of only 95

printed on Hahnemuhle acid-free 300 gsm etching paper

image size 40 x 40 cms

paper size 45 x 45 cms

signed, titled and numbered by the artist

FREE postage and packaging
